00134 /* boolean value defs */
00135 #ifndef TRUE
00136 #define TRUE 1
00137 #endif
00138 #ifndef FALSE
00139 #define FALSE 0
00140 #endif
00141 
00142 /* various useful macros */
00143 #ifndef MAX
00144 #define MAX(a, b)    (((a) < (b)) ? (b) : (a))
00145 #endif
00146 #ifndef MIN
00147 #define MIN(a, b)    (((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00148 #endif
00149 
00150 /* for printing out "long long" vars */
00151 #define LLHIGH(L)               ((int)(((L)>>32) & 0xffffffff))
00152 #define LLLOW(L)                ((int)((L) & 0xffffffff))
00153 
00154 /* size of an array, in elements */
00155 #define N_ELT(ARR)   (sizeof(ARR)/sizeof((ARR)[0]))
00156 
00157 /* rounding macros, assumes ALIGN is a power of two */
00158 #define ROUND_UP(N,ALIGN)       (((N) + ((ALIGN)-1)) & ~((ALIGN)-1))
00159 #define ROUND_DOWN(N,ALIGN)     ((N) & ~((ALIGN)-1))

00162 /* active debug flag */
00163 extern bool debugging;
00164 #endif /* DEBUG */

00166 /* register a function to be called when an error is detected */
00167 void
00168 fatal_hook(void (*hook_fn)(FILE *stream));      /* fatal hook function */
00169 
00170 #ifdef __GNUC__
00171 /* declare a fatal run-time error, calls fatal hook function */
00172 #define fatal(fmt, args...)     \
00173   _fatal(__FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, fmt, ## args)
00174 
00175 void
00176 _fatal(const char *file, const char *func, const int line, const char *fmt, ...)
00177 __attribute__ ((noreturn));
00178 #else /* !__GNUC__ */
00179 void
00180 fatal(const char *fmt, ...);
00181 #endif /* !__GNUC__ */
00182 
00183 #ifdef __GNUC__
00184 /* declare a panic situation, dumps core */
00185 #define panic(fmt, args...)     \
00186   _panic(__FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, fmt, ## args)
00187 
00188 void
00189 _panic(const char *file, const char *func, const int line, const char *fmt, ...)
00190 __attribute__ ((noreturn));
00191 #else /* !__GNUC__ */
00192 void
00193 panic(const char *fmt, ...);
00194 #endif /* !__GNUC__ */
00195 
00196 #ifdef __GNUC__
00197 /* declare a warning */
00198 #define warn(fmt, args...)      \
00199   _warn(__FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, fmt, ## args)
00200 
00201 void
00202 _warn(const char *file, const char *func, const int line, const char *fmt, ...);
00203 #else /* !__GNUC__ */
00204 void
00205 warn(const char *fmt, ...);
00206 #endif /* !__GNUC__ */
00207 
00208 #ifdef __GNUC__
00209 /* declare a oneshot warning */
00210 #define warnonce(fmt, args...)                                          \
00211   do {                                                                  \
00212     static int __first = TRUE;                                          \
00213     if (__first) _warn(__FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, fmt, ## args); \
00214     __first = FALSE;                                                    \
00215   } while (0)
00216 void
00217 _warn(const char *file, const char *func, const int line, const char *fmt, ...);
00218 #else /* !__GNUC__ */
00219 void
00220 warn(const char *fmt, ...);
00221 #endif /* !__GNUC__ */
00222 
00223 #ifdef __GNUC__
00224 /* print general information */
00225 #define info(fmt, args...)      \
00226   _info(__FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, fmt, ## args)
00227 
00228 void
00229 _info(const char *file, const char *func, const int line, const char *fmt, ...);
00230 #else /* !__GNUC__ */
00231 void
00232 info(const char *fmt, ...);
00233 #endif /* !__GNUC__ */
00234 
00235 #ifdef DEBUG
00236 
00237 #ifdef __GNUC__
00238 /* print a debugging message */
00239 #define debug(fmt, args...)     \
00240     do {                        \
00241         if (debugging)          \
00242             _debug(__FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, fmt, ## args); \
00243     } while(0)
00244 
00245 void
00246 _debug(const char *file, const char *func, const int line, const char *fmt, ...);
00247 #else /* !__GNUC__ */
00248 void
00249 debug(const char *fmt, ...);
00250 #endif /* !__GNUC__ */
00251 
00252 #else /* !DEBUG */
00253 
00254 #ifdef __GNUC__
00255 #define debug(fmt, args...)
00256 #else /* !__GNUC__ */
00257 /* the optimizer should eliminate this call! */
00258 static void debug(const char *fmt, ...) {}
00259 #endif /* !__GNUC__ */
00260 
00261 #endif /* !DEBUG */

00278 /* copy a string to a new storage allocation (NOTE: many machines are missing
00279    this trivial function, so I funcdup() it here...) */
00280 char *                          /* duplicated string */
00281 mystrdup(const char *s);                /* string to duplicate to heap storage */
00282 
00283 /* find the last occurrence of a character in a string */
00284 const char *
00285 mystrrchr(const char *s, const char c);
00286 
00287 /* case insensitive string compare (NOTE: many machines are missing this
00288    trivial function, so I funcdup() it here...) */
00289 int                             /* compare result, see strcmp() */
00290 mystricmp(const char *s1, const char *s2);      /* strings to compare, case insensitive */
00291 
00292 /* return log of a number to the base 2 */
00293 int log_base2(const int n);
00294 
00295 /* return string describing elapsed time, passed in SEC in seconds */
00296 char *elapsed_time(long sec);

00301 char *myvsprintf(char *obuf, const char *format, va_list v);
00302 
00303 /* portable sprintf with qword support, returns end pointer */
00304 char *mysprintf(char *obuf, const char *format, ...);
00305

00307 void myvfprintf(FILE *stream, const char *format, va_list v);
00308 
00309 /* portable fprintf with qword support, returns end pointer */
00310 void myfprintf(FILE *stream, const char *format, ...);

00315 sqword_t myatosq(char *nptr, char **endp, int base);
00316

00318 qword_t myatoq(char *nptr, char **endp, int base);

00320 #endif /* HOST_HAS_QWORD */

00322 /* same semantics as fopen() except that filenames ending with a ".gz" or ".Z"
00323    will be automagically get compressed */
00324 FILE *gzopen(const char *fname, const char *type);
00325 
00326 /* close compressed stream */
00327 void gzclose(FILE *fd);
00328 
00329 /* fast modulo increment/decrement:
00330    gcc on -O1 or higher will if-convert the following functions
00331    to provide much cheaper implementations of increment and
00332    decrement modulo some arbitrary value (not necessarily a
00333    power of two).  NOTE: argument x *must* be in the range
00334    0 .. (m-1), otherwise this code will not work! */
00335 
00336 /* returns (x+1)%m */
00337 inline int modinc(int x, int m)
00338 {
00339   int xinc = x+1;
00340   if(xinc==m)
00341     xinc = 0;
00342   return xinc;
00343 }
00344 
00345 /* returns (x-1+m)%m */
00346 inline int moddec(int x, int m)
00347 {
00348   int xdec = x-1;
00349   if(x==0)
00350     xdec = m-1;
00351   return xdec;
00352 }
00353 
00354 /* returns x%m; NOTE: x must be in the range 0 .. (2m-1) */
00355 inline int mod2m(int x, int m)
00356 {
00357   int ret = x;
00358   if(x >= m)
00359     ret = ret - m;
00360   return ret;
00361 }
00362 
00363 /* fast memset macros - uses GCC's inline assembly */
00364 void memzero(void * base, int bytes);
00365 void clear_page(void * base);
00366 void memswap(void * p1, void * p2, size_t num_bytes);
00367 
00368 #ifdef __cplusplus
00369 }
00370 #endif

00372 #endif /* MISC_H */
